summary: This document is a record of an additional inquiry response from the FBI New York office to the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services (DCJS). It appears to be part of an ongoing information exchange or investigation, referencing a prior inquiry and a 'stale delayed response'.

persons.name: Michael C. Green
persons.role: Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services
persons.context: He is listed as the recipient or a key official associated with the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services, which is the agency receiving the FBI's response.

events.title: FBI Additional Inquiry Response to NYS DCJS
events.description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation - New York office sends an 'Additional Inquiry Response' to the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services.

locations.name: Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan St., Albany, New York 12210
locations.context: The address for the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services.

locations.name: New York
locations.context: Location of the FBI office and the state agency involved in the correspondence.

keyFacts: The document is an 'Additional Inquiry Response' from the FBI New York office to the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services (DCJS).
The response is labeled as related to a 'Stale Delayed Response', indicating it addresses a prior, overdue inquiry.
The correspondence is dated October 6, 2021, showing investigative activity years after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The document highlights inter-agency communication (FBI to NYS DCJS) regarding the Epstein case or related matters.
Michael C. Green is identified as the Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS DCJS at the time.
